Now, I'll determine the assembly order. Generally, we build from bottom to top:

For the right structure:

content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows two distinct structures on a dark blue checkered floor:

## Left Structure:
- A simple arrangement with 3 blocks in a single layer:
  - Two adjacent yellow semicylindrical blocks
  - A green cube
  - A blue cube placed next to the green cube

## Right Structure:
- A construction resembling a toy vehicle/truck with 5 blocks in 3 layers:
  - Bottom layer: Two orange cylindrical blocks positioned horizontally (wheels)
  - Middle layer: Two yellow rectangular blocks stacked (one horizontal, one placed on top)
  - Top layer: A blue cube placed on the upper yellow rectangular block

## Block Count and Spatial Relationships
- Total blocks: 8
- The left structure has all blocks on the same level arranged side by side
- The right structure has a hierarchical arrangement with the blue cube sitting on yellow blocks, which sit on orange cylinders

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Looking at the block dictionary, I need the following blocks:

1. Block #12 (yellow semicylinder) - Used twice in the left structure
2. Block #2 (green cube) - Used once in the left structure
3. Block #1 (blue cube) - Used twice (once in each structure)
4. Block #10 and #11 (orange horizontal cylinders) - Used as wheels in the right structure
5. Block #7 (yellow horizontal rectangular block) - Used in the right structure base
6. Block #8 (yellow vertical rectangular block) - Used in the right structure upper part

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 12
  Step2: Move block with index 12
  Step3: Move block with index 2
  Step4: Move block with index 1
  Step5: Move block with index 10
  Step6: Move block with index 11
  Step7: Move block with index 7
  Step8: Move block with index 8
  Step9: Move block with index 1
}
```
